website_summaries.verdict: This expertly constructed mount can be used with a wide range of projectors.
pros: High-grade steel construction guarantees the mount can support projectors up to 30 pounds
Mount is fully adjustable for added convenience
Equipped with quick-release hooks for fast, easy installation
cons: Sometimes can be tough to adjust the mount

customer_reviews.title: As good as the Epson $150 mount
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly fit my Epson 2150. I was a little worried because my Epson only has three places for it to mount but I just removed one of the arms and it was just fine. Epson makes their own mount and it's about $150 and this mount works just as well!
customer_reviews.author: bongypoo

customer_reviews.title: Screws are too short
customer_reviews.text: Installation is relatively straight forward, the major issue we encountered was that the screws are too short to catch the projector so we aren’t able to use it for our particular model of projector which is the Vankyo 510. We have a pretty unhealthy collection of screws in our arsenal but could not find any we already have on hand that would work. I’m sure we can find the right screws at the hardware store but that’s obviously annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsay Collins

customer_reviews.title: Works for Optoma HD 71
customer_reviews.text: Worked for the Optoma HD 71 It was packaged nicely and came with a lot of extra screws. I was able to take out one of the hinges which makes the projector sit about 2 inches closer to the ceiling. I didn't want it to hang so low. It was generally easy to install and self explanatory, but I'm good with my hands. These kinds of things come easy to me. The anchors and lags that came along with it are VERY heavy duty and I'm extremely confident that the projector isn't going anywhere. My projector has only 3 mounting holes, I wasn't sure how that would work, but it ended up working out just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Neal Mummau

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to adjust and shaky.  Avoid!!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely hard to adjust without it moving as you tighten the screws. It will not stay put even after you tighten it. It is very susceptible to vibrations and you can see it in the projected image. You get what you pay for, as the saying goes. I replaced it with a Peerless PRG-UNV and haven't looked back.
customer_reviews.author: Smithlord

customer_reviews.title: Fits Epson 2040 perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a white ceiling mount that was built tough and would fit my new Epson 2040. This projector mount fits the bill. It's build tough and meets what I needed and will definately suffice for supporting a 7 lbs projector. It includes all hardware with a ton of extra bolts and washers which are both plastic and metal. Like the popular Epson 2030, the 2040 & 2045 only use 3 arms and this fits like a glove and should never need adjusted. I couldn't be happier. Thank you VIVO.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Ducharme

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my LG Projector!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this ceiling mount for my LG pa77u LED projector and after an hour out of the box I was watching movies on the big screen. Simple instructions for installation. They give you drywall screws AND lag screws for going straight into wood. Many ways to adjust the mount for different angles. I would recommend this product and will update my review if this ceiling mount does not hold up to my projector's needs. (pun intended)
customer_reviews.author: Adam J.

customer_reviews.title: excellent for the price
customer_reviews.text: I looked at a number of ceiling mounts for my Epson 2150 projector before purchasing this one. I wondered why there was such a large price difference between this and the mount recommended to me by a big box store. The differences I found were minimal and didn't seem worth the large price difference so I purchased this one. It's been a few months and this one has worked great. Installation was easy and the mount is stable and easy to adjust.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor

customer_reviews.title: Solid all metal construction; multiple installation surfaces
customer_reviews.text: I used this to mount a consumer size ~$100 projector, but it seems plenty sturdy enough for something heavier. The entire thing is metal, other than some plastic washers used to keep joints flexible. There are large screws for attaching the mount to the ceiling, with plastic anchors if needed. Instructions include info on mounting on concrete and more. For connecting your projector to the mount, there are 4 sizes of 4 screws each included, so this should work for mounting just about anything; you likely won't need to purchase separate screws. Once installed, it's easy enough to adjust; you can tighten the screws as needed with the included hex wrench. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Kovaciny

customer_reviews.title: Liked it, but didn't use it
customer_reviews.text: You know...when you spend $5000 on a projector, why skimp on the mount? But I bought this mount just to see if an inexpensive mount like this would be enough, and my answer is maybe. But compared to the mount I used, which was much thicker and heavier grade material, I was concerned that the VIVO mount may fail. That feeling could have been entirely misguided and incorrect. But I'll stand by my opening sentence.
customer_reviews.author: Tony C

customer_reviews.title: Overall a cheap product
customer_reviews.text: Installed on a BenQ projector. Bought because of the low profile option and semi-decent reviews, we figured we’d be safe with this. We were wrong. One of the bracket holes stripped out 2 of the bolts that controls the vertical hang adjustment. The worst part is the mount does not keep the projector level and there is no adjusting that can be done to correct it. It hangs the projector on about a 5-6% decline from right to left, which is extremely noticeable when leveled against our screen. I don’t want to mess with uninstalling and sending back, so we are buying a more expensive one that will be sturdier. We got what we paid for.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin

customer_reviews.title: Solid and easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. I installed this in my basement where the ceiling is about 6'10". I didn't want something that was going to hang low and someone runs into head-on. So this low profile close to the ceiling projector mount was perfect! Installation was easy the directions that came with the item were straightforward. It's sturdy, it's not going to move at all. My advice take your time, because the last thing you need is bunch of holes in your ceiling. Once you find that sweet spot, just tighten the screws and you're good to go. I'm happy with this projector mount, plus you can't beat the price. (recommend)
customer_reviews.author: Maximo

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy setup, extremely adjustable!
customer_reviews.text: I was at first kind of skeptical that I would be receiving a reliable mount at this price range but I was very wrong. Make sure you have a drill and bits for a phillip head and drill type bit because you will definitely need those! It is very sturdy and very adjustable. You can't go wrong with this mount. Just make sure it will fit your projector even though the fitting piece seems to be able to fit all sorts of sizes and shapes. I will update if any problems arise in the near future but so far so good! :)
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Jay Ozment

customer_reviews.title: OK for very small projectors.
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps my expectations were too high for a mount that sells for about 17 bucks. I was mounting an Epson 3xxx series Ultra Bright home theater projector. The mount BARELY fits the spread of connector positions on the bottom of the projector. It does hold the weight, and I'm not worried that it will fall... at the same time, it is not very rigid/stiff at all. The slightest touch sets the projector to moving. I'm going to get a stronger mount. Meanwhile, this one does have the PJ up by the ceiling, so that's a start!!
customer_reviews.author: Danal

customer_reviews.title: Painless. So painless.
customer_reviews.text: This mount was so easy to install! I am not a handy individual and I had zero difficulty. I very quickly removed the fourth mounting arm (my projector as three mounting sockets) and connected the bottom half to the projector. Once I located a stud, the top half was screwed to the ceiling. I hung the bottom half (with projector attached), tightened the screws and it was mounted. From there I simply adjusted the orientation, tightened those screws and was done. This mount is plenty sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: J Bubba

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit BenQ HT3550
customer_reviews.text: This mount cannot fit one of the holes due to the rounded design in that area of the projector.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: This mount is very easy to install and keeps the projector close to the ceiling. The required hardware was in the box, including the machined screws that attach to the projector itself. There is lots of adjustability , so even if you make a slight mistake you can fix it without re-mounting the base. I liked the fact that you could hang the projector first before you had to adjust and tighten. It is also very inexpensive; I have paid over one hundred dollars in the past for projector specific ceiling mounts.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Francis

customer_reviews.title: Includes everything needed, including the hex wrench.
customer_reviews.text: I have temporarily used the mount to place the projector on a floor stand until we can mount it from the ceiling of our church. The plate, normally mounted from the ceiling, was screwed to the top of the stool. I had made an adjustable platen which was always needing readjusted befiore each service. I was pleasantly surprised at the variety of screws supplied with the mount. It took less than 20 minutes from start to finish including adjusting the projector alignment with the screen. To paraphrase a popular commercial "It's such a quality product for the price".
customer_reviews.author: S Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and lazy craftsmanship
customer_reviews.text: Mounting bolts are as cheap as they come. Using minimal torque the bolts just shredded. I decided to use a socket instead since the bolts have a hex head. Again, with minimal torque the bolt almost sheared off; Mind you this was going into a pre drilled hole. Besides the bolts this thing has over a dozen points to pivot from which is convenient but c'mon you couldnt take the effort to paint them the same color as the mount so they aren't so noticeable. Cheap and lazy craftsmanship.
customer_reviews.author: A. Amante

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive and stout mount
customer_reviews.text: The mount is very sturdy and easily adjusted. It says quick disconnect, but you have to remove 2 allen head screws in order to do so, so it's not really quick. If they would have replaced those with maybe wingnuts they could claim that. Otherwise, it does what it is supposed to and the projector is easily tilted in any direction to give the picture you want. I wanted something that I could buy 2 of and move the projector back and forth between the 2 mounts but this won't quite fit the bill. Otherwise, its a good mount.
customer_reviews.author: BT

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use - arms don't work with all projectors
customer_reviews.text: I acquired an older model projector recently that I wanted to mount on the ceiling in my unfinished basement. This worked well, but the arms included didn't work with my projector since they were all raised (no flush arms option). I was able to DIY a solution myself though so I didn't have to return it for a different product. Very sturdy overall though and a good buy for under $15 I'd recommend. Blessings!
customer_reviews.author: A Branch

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and great price.
customer_reviews.text: Just as described I can imagine this thing works with many different projectors because of all the different possible configurations. Therefore there are no Specific Instructions so you must kind of be tech savvy or mechanical savvy to figure out set up as per your projector. Although I have not yet hung up my projector I did check it out of the box and it fits my projector just fine because I took my measurements ahead of time before choosing this unit.
customer_reviews.author: All The World's a Stage

customer_reviews.title: Holds perfectly without shifting under projector's weight
customer_reviews.text: I had a different brand ceiling mount, but getting the projector leveled was almost impossible. Inevitably the weight of the projector would cause the mount to move and the image would become crooked. I have a large 4k projector and needed a very sturdy ceiling mount. In frustration, I researched a lot of mounts, and after reading all the reviews, I bought this mount. It worked perfectly. The drop from the ceiling is about 4-5 inches. The screws all hold tightly without letting the projector shift once tightened. For the price it was excellent. Very happy and highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Norcal

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my Ben Q
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use with my recently purchased Ben Q projector. It mounts up great to the projector and mounts good to where I have it attached. It can be a bit of a pain to adjust. This I do not knock the product as I believe with any product similar the same issues can come into play depending on how you are mounting the projector and the angles needed to be achieved. For what the product is designed to do I have had no issues. I ordered the black to go with the room in which it was being set up.
customer_reviews.author: DAAL

customer_reviews.title: The little engine that could
customer_reviews.text: It is all metal construction and sturdy. I purchased it because it has a weight rating of 30 LBS (13.6 Kilos), but only intended it to hold a projector weighing approx 15 LBS (6.8 Kilos). It installs in two parts; one upper mount into the ceiling, and one lower mount onto the projector, which then slips onto the upper mount and locks in place. It swivels both from side to side and back and forth to allow for perfect aligning with the screen. In my installation, I mounted the upper mount into a crossbeam for added support. For the price, it can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Scruffy Lookin'

customer_reviews.title: Product is well designed and was immediately adjustable to fit ...
customer_reviews.text: Product is well designed and was immediately adjustable to fit my projector. Unfortunately 12 hex head screws were required, they only sent 10., plus a significant number of Philips head screws and washers, which were not needed. I now have to stop the installation and go to specialty hardware stores to try and get the additional 2 screws. Highly frustrating!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to mount my projector from the ceiling and after reading numerous reviews I bought this. Very sturdy and highly adjustable (even after you have everything mounted up). It comes with basic equipment to mount into drywall (the ones you have to pre drill for, hammer in, then drill a screw directly into that) so i suggest getting better drywall mounts if you cannot find a stud. Thats no fault to this set though, wouldn't expect it to have the more expensive mounts.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Low clearance, versitile projector mount.
customer_reviews.text: I use it to mount this projector ( and it works just fine. We have a low ceiling 8' in the basement so this one is just enough for the job. It can tilt at different angles like a universal joint. It held that tilt with the projector. The only down-side of the product is that the screws it came with did not match the projector mounting holes. I understand it can not possibly match all the projectors out there but still an inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne

customer_reviews.title: Not very adjustable
customer_reviews.text: I try to use it with Optoma UHD 50. It fitted fine and was easy to install. It feels sturdy too however i had to return it as the tilt adjustment was not very stable and fine tune capable. I could tilt the projector and get picture aligned and after i tightened teh screws the projector will not hold in the position. I went for PRGS-UNV which has better adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: Vinit Gupta

customer_reviews.title: Does not interface with BenQ HT3550 (without modification).
customer_reviews.text: This is not a bad quality product, however, it does not interface with BenQ HT3550 (without modification). It would be helpful if the seller would provide a complete list of compatible projectors. The addition of standoffs/ plastic spacers and some longer screws in the hardware kit would improve compatibility with additional projector models and cost pennies. I returned the product due to incomplete description and lack of compatibility.
customer_reviews.author: NY GUY

customer_reviews.title: For the price it's pretty good.
customer_reviews.text: This is a decent projector mount for what it costs. It get's the job done. Seems pretty cheaply made, but hey they price is nice. -I was mounting on a low ceiling so I ended up taking out the middle adjustment, and was able to mount the top bracket to the bottom one, and still maintain 1.5 degrees of adjustment and reduce the height of the mount and get the projector higher. -Limited selection of screws in the kit, depending on your projector screw depth you might need longer screws. No spacers either.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Blosser

customer_reviews.title: Good mount. Terrible instructions.
customer_reviews.text: Once you get it installed, the mount is fine. It's the getting there that sucks. There are no words, there's no indication (until you've already drilled and installed the ceiling piece) which way the ceiling piece should be oriented. The illustrations are inconsistent in terms of how many washers are used (both plastic and metal) when attaching the projector to the ceiling piece.
customer_reviews.author: G.Young

customer_reviews.title: No Regrets
customer_reviews.text: VERY Nice Mount. Really Nice Mount. Loving this Mount. No matter how I type it, I have absolutely no complaints regarding this mount. Easy install-simple four screw mount. Purchased for my Epson 2045. Needed a low profile mount, for a low ceiling. I couldn't have custom designed this any better to accomudate my needs. Mounting brackets are universal, you can customize to fit with your unit (projector), which assembled easily to the projector. Adjusted and locked project in for great veiwing. Packaged with three different sytled set of screws for projector mounting. Delivery was within 2 days :) Bottom line..very satisfied
customer_reviews.author: Reese

customer_reviews.title: Great and Simple
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased a ViewSonic PJD7720HD 3200 Lumens 1080p HDMI Home Theater Projector, I knew I would need a way to keep it connected to the ceiling. I didn't know what the heck I was doing, so I bought this one. It was very intuitive and simple to set up! It took me almost no time and I was able to do it with the tools in the box. It was simple. A total beginner could figure this out. Take it from a true beginner! It requires no mechanical ability whatsoever. A brief note-- you'll need a drill. There's no way to screw this into the ceiling. Still, love it and would recommend this wholeheartedly.
customer_reviews.author: TypicalRhino14

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this mount. Got the ben q mh530fhd on this with just 2 regular drywall screws right into the ceiling no stud. Projector is so light it's not even an issue. I saw another review mention removing part of this mount to get it closer to the ceiling and that worked great. I'm about 4" away which is as far as I would go. Only thing I wish I could do is make it lock into place so if I'm ever unplugging cords it doesn't swivel around at all but not a big deal
customer_reviews.author: JTStudios

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product for the price
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product for the price. All hardware is included. The large bolts require an 11mm nut driver, so if you were planning to install with a cordless impact, check your sockets before you get started. You can use a Philips, but if you are driving them into anything solid, (and you should) then you will probably round them out. Extremely easy to adjust. Would absolutely love a quick release for removing half of the bracket with projector. I'm using it under the roof over my patio. Don't like leaving the projector outside. So taking off easier would be great. 1st world problems.....
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great mount!!
customer_reviews.text: First let me say I'm not a home theatre snob by any means. I bought my Optoma projector back in 2009. The mounts available then were crap so when I moved, I finally decided to upgrade and this mount is so much better. It has much better adjustments and holds its position fine. My projector is pretty light, so maybe that helps, but this one met all my needs and looks pretty good doing it
customer_reviews.author: I. Wainwright

customer_reviews.title: Works great! Epson home movie projector
customer_reviews.text: This thing works great! It was interesting to install, but not overly difficult! It was pretty self-explanatory, although it did take some time to find studs in the ceiling, line them up correctly, and then mount the projector to the holder. For the price, I don't think this thing can be beat! We have been using it for about two months now, and it holds up VERY well - keeps our picture pretty much exactly where we want it without ever really moving or shaking. For the price, you have to buy it! Cheap and holds up great! I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and quality.
customer_reviews.text: As you can see, we had to alter it in order to make it work for us. This is only because we have an extra beam that it had to be installed on, and we did not want to hang too low. It is still easily maneuverable and it works great for our needs. FYI - It comes with various types of screws for various models of projectors. Please don’t go out and buy special stuff like I did. What it came with it was more than enough!
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Great mount for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Overall, I thought this worked very well. I mounted a favi 4T projector with this. Now, I will say that it didn't quite fit the favi (it's a bit different than other projectors I've used). I had to only use 3 mounting brackets on the projector instead of 4. It held the projector securely however. I had no issues with it feeling insecure. I think it looks nice as well. I found it easy to adjust the projector to the screen. Over all, good build and finish. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: shawn stevens

customer_reviews.title: some quality control issues
customer_reviews.text: This mount was not very good for me. It had serious quality control issues. The holes to screw in the bolts to allow the projector to hang were too big for the screws and thus I was unable to tightened them which basically made the mount useless as gravity would make the projector drop. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: NE

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and EZ to install
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install, took me about 10 minutes. At first when I opened, I didn’t think any of the screws would fit my projectors holes (my mistake for not checking the holes before purchase) but was no problem!! They include 3 different size washers and screws!!! One of the 3 fit perfect and wah lah. Also it got here within 16 hours of me ordering.. crazy af
customer_reviews.author: Clancy

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Though not ideal for a projector with only one screw mount, it does the trick. If you have upstairs neighbors, be sure to install it when they're not home -- banging a hammer on the ceiling is SO MUCH LOUDER than on a wall. It took me about 45 minutes to install and it only moves when I move it. If it had come with an adapter for my projector, which has only one screw mount on the bottom, they'd have earned that fifth star.
customer_reviews.author: M. L. Albright

customer_reviews.title: Super easy installalation !
customer_reviews.text: nothing to dislike here . I had it installed in minutes couldn't believe it ' considering I have had other projector mounts that had been difficult to install and took hrs. adjustments side to side up and down work smoothly and the unit is solid ' couldn't be happier with my purchase ..... not to mention it arrived fast ..... AWESOME!
customer_reviews.author: Kirby

customer_reviews.title: The greatest distance on mine was 11
customer_reviews.text: I read the specifications for this prior to purchase and was sure to measure the distance of the threaded holes on my projector to be sure this would work. The description says the holes must be within 12.5" from each other. The greatest distance on mine was 11.5" (side to side), and this would not fit mine. I had to fabricate an extension for this to work properly. If it helps others, my projector is a Mitsubishi XL25U. Otherwise this seems like a solidly built product. VIVO, please fix your item description.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Solid hanger.
customer_reviews.text: Good product for the price. Could use some notching to help stabilize the final location of the joints as opposed to needing to crank down on the bolts to hold the final position. Took some creative fashioning to get the legs to line up with the optima projector. No concern at all that it is strong enough and the adjustment is more than enough to get a good position on the projector. Does come with all necessary hardware too.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked Perfectly With BenQ HT2050
customer_reviews.text: This product worked perfectly to mount my BenQ HT2050. Fine adjustments were a little bit more time consuming and sensitive than I would have liked, especially when projecting onto a thin bezel screen which requires precision. With a little patience I was able to get things set up perfectly. Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not truly universal- what out for Amazon recommendation with your projector
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT universal. My husband purchased this when it came up as a recommended "purchase together" option with his Optima projector selection on Amazon BUT it is NOT compatible. Returning and ordered the mount that is a triangle shape and compatible with our unit.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle K

customer_reviews.title: Does Not work with Epson Home Cinema 3800, 4K 3 LCD Projector
customer_reviews.text: Does Not work with Epson Home Cinema 3800. Spacing of holes in metal arms is too short to reach 4 of the holes in projector
customer_reviews.author: E-Consumer

customer_reviews.title: I'd say go for another.
customer_reviews.text: The actual product is great for the price but when tightening my screw it broke off inside the projector and with little force! Now I even have a projector that can no longer be mounted! If you choose to buy this mount I'd buy screws separately and not use the ones inside the box.
customer_reviews.author: T Machin

customer_reviews.title: Great mount paired with Epson VS340
customer_reviews.text: Mount installs easily. Bolts that come with mount were a little long for me so I ended up using some smaller ones I had around the house other then that the mount it great perfectly adjustable and better yet easy to adjust and put together. Using with a Epson VS340 but can definitely use with any projector.
customer_reviews.author: Tomas Deleon

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my projector!
customer_reviews.text: Using for the basement projector in the entertainment space. Comes with all screws needed to mount to the ceiling and mount your projector, and the allen wrench to tighten the joints once positioned properly. Plenty of adjustment for a wide variety of projectors!
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: easy to install in ceiling
customer_reviews.text: easy to install in ceiling. Stable. Install the screen first. Hardest part (probably the same for any mount) was finding the best location so that the image filled the screen as completely as possible. Easier to do if you have a zoom lens. Try to install in a ceiling joist directly if possible. I used it on a ViewSonic PJD5255 3300 Lumens XGA HDMI Projector (2017 Model) and is solid as a rock, stable.
customer_reviews.author: Plain 'Ole Pop

customer_reviews.title: Would recommend!
customer_reviews.text: Finally installed this mount and it's perfect! Comes with all the pieces needed and a detailed instruction manual. We're not handymen, but my husband and I were able to put together and install this just fine. As long as you have someone to hold the mount as someone else uses the power drill, this should be quick and easy. The mount and project feel very secure. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: R.

customer_reviews.title: fit perfect for our suspended ceiling.
customer_reviews.text: The electrician who installed our projector mount said it was easy to install. I works well with our suspended ceiling which is often a problem. I wish I had seen the white colored model which would have blended better with the ceiling tiles. No complaints
customer_reviews.author: John H

customer_reviews.title: Check your projector mounting options
customer_reviews.text: PLEASE double check your projector mounting options/availabilities before purchasing this product. I bought it because as a "Frequently bought together" option was below my projector and the GBLife projector I purchased does not have any mounting holes. Amazon, or whoever makes the frequently purchased together recommendations didnt gar this one right.🤔
customer_reviews.author: Rroper

customer_reviews.title: Great Mount
customer_reviews.text: I bought this mount with budget in mind and I was not disappointed. I did mount this to a wimius p18 projector and the mount was easy to install with great adjusment possibilities. I did not end up using this mount in particular because the projector itself could not overcome the keystone settings. I ended up mounting the projector 3 whole feet lower than the vivo mount could. The only reason I went with a different mount is my fault for not ordering a mount with a drop-down extension. This vivo mount for a ceiling mount is a great value and will definitely do you right. I would recommend this for anyone with a home theater install.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Francis

customer_reviews.title: It works really well
customer_reviews.text: This thing is pretty amazing. I bought it for my benq 2050a, and the thing stays in place and is very sturdy. Every angle is adjustable, and mine projects a straight picture from a slanted dome ceiling. I gave 4 stars because adjusting everything takes a while to do... but once its done.... its done.
customer_reviews.author: Big Head

customer_reviews.title: Great mount for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great little mount. Lots of configurations and an assortment of screws to fit almost any projector. Lots of adjustment points to get the picture in the right position. Very sturdy! You will need wood screws if you are going into a stud. The mount screws provided are meant for the provided anchors. I recommend this nice low profile mount for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Bernadette O Guerrero

customer_reviews.title: it doesn't droop like other mounts do
customer_reviews.text: Rock solid. My projector is not balanced well, all the weight is to the side. I was able to tighten the adjuster bolts and it stays where I put it, it doesn't droop like other mounts do. Only complaint is that I ordered black to save a couple of bucks, but I got the white one instead. Not a deal breaker. I'm not paying attention to the mount when I'm watching stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Lovell

customer_reviews.title: Mounting for days
customer_reviews.text: Definitely a solid mount, I actually mounted my projector on top of my media cabinet (right side up, mount on the bottom of the projector) instead of the ceiling, and it worked out perfectly. Assembly took less than 1 minute, and it included TONS of screws of every size. I have at least 25 left over pieces. It includes everything needed to mount, including anchors, allen wrench, screws, thumb screws, washers, etc. This thing stays rock solid, and seems extraordinarily sturdy. Good buy :)
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Great basic, low-profile mount.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect beginner’s mount for a fairly low profile projector installation. Install took me about 20 minutes, and most of that time was spent testing out the right distance and angle to figure out where to install this bracket. Once I had it marked, installation and adjustment was a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Derek G

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: A little awkward getting the pieces to be able to screw into the mounting holes but otherwise it’s great! Heavy duty. Adjustable to fit many different projectors (as the stock photos show. And saved me well over $250 on the one for sale at the store we bought our projector at.
customer_reviews.author: Mila

customer_reviews.title: Worked great for my BenQ TK800
customer_reviews.text: This mount worked great for my BenQ TK800. Installation was fairly quick but could have been made easier if all of the mounting screws weren't mixed together. They provide a couple of different sizes to accommodate the different projector screw mounts.
customer_reviews.author: The Average Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Hold my projector on the ceiling and allows me to adjust my projector for my screen. I never used a projector before so hanging it from the ceiling was a little worrisome but this bracket was a good choice from amazon with the projector.
customer_reviews.author: michael a. brown

customer_reviews.title: Originally did not fit my projector (My bad. ) But made it work by fixing mending ...
customer_reviews.text: Originally did not fit my projector (My bad.) But made it work by fixing mending plates to two of the arms in the back and using small bolts with nyloc nuts for attaching them as extenders. I screwed them into the joist in my ceiling, but the holes on the long side were a little too wide for the joist, so I used construction adhesive with the anchors to keep them in place, trusting that the two screwed into the wood would bear a lot of the weight no problem. Works fine, very easy to adjust and holding on pretty well. I decided to not buy a larger size mount because I felt that this one was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great low profile mount (but could use better instructions)
customer_reviews.text: Great mount. Instructions could be waaaay better but it didn't take long to figure it out. If you keep in mind that they give you extra screws and hardware so you can connect the mount to different projectors, you won't be confused. Also keep in mind this is a low profile mount. My support beam is low so it worked great. If you have a high ceiling you may need a different mount.
customer_reviews.author: BT Prime

customer_reviews.title: Small and strong and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This is an extremely versatile projector mount! I had to install our projector on a slanted portion of the ceiling, and it was so easy. The mounting arms are highly adjustable, and since our unit only had three mounting screws, I was able to remove one of the arms. There is a bag with many different screw sizes to match just about any kind of projector, and it includes the Allen wrench needed to tighten the joints. Very pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.author: W. Sisson

customer_reviews.title: Love this mount!  Works perfectly and great price!
customer_reviews.text: This mount was so easy to use. I did put an extra 2x4 in the attic to secure the projector but it worked perfectly. The versatility of the mount in its universa ability was great. Took only 20 minutes to get it up right after adding the 2x4 but looks great. Perfect match for my projector.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not universal
customer_reviews.text: Not universal. Screws too short to mount to Optoma HD243x. Will try to find longer screws at the hardware store, but would be nice if mfr would include to support multi models, making it "universal" like it claims to be.
customer_reviews.author: C. White

customer_reviews.title: Solid Mount
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to mount our projector on the ceiling. The double pivot causes the projector to hang quite low, so we took out one of the pivots and just made sure that the mount was positioned properly. It has been holding strong for the past 9 months without any issues and does not vibrate at all when the fan on the projector is going at full speed.
customer_reviews.author: CKirk

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Really like it.. can be a bit difficult to install.. I was hoping for something that made for quicker dismounting and mounting because I like to move my projector around through the house.. but this is great for the money
customer_reviews.author: Jason Clark

customer_reviews.title: 12.5" is diagonal!!! Doesn't work with Epson 3500 Cinema Projector
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed to find out that the 12.5" max was diagonal. It mentions this being the max distance between screw holes numerous times and it's not until the very bottom of the description that it says that's diagonal. Of course I didn't notice this until after I ordered it. Looks to be a well made mount, but if you have a rather large projector order the QualGear QG-PM-002-WHT-S. Its pretty much the same mount for 4 cents less and it has adjustable arms for a longer diagonal reach.
customer_reviews.author: Custominor

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up hanging projector mount
customer_reviews.text: A simple unit, easy to install, easily set up ceiling hung projector mount. Seems very sturdy and has a wide variety of adjustments. Once set, the projector mount holds it's settings. Holds our projector perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Kewlgrandpa

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic mount for my Benq projector
customer_reviews.text: Used this to mount my Benq HT2050 projector and it worked perfectly. I only needed 3 of the 4 legs for my projector. The adjustments are numerous so getting it just right is not much trouble at all. I just put my projector up in the general area and then made the adjustments on this mount. There are plenty of bolts and washers included with the mount so I had everything I needed. Very sturdy and a great price.
customer_reviews.author: TennesseeSig

customer_reviews.title: It does the job.
customer_reviews.text: I have a low end epson projector that I'm mounting. This mount has a lot of versatility in how you can connect. The projector I have only had 3 mounting points, but it was easy to just take off the fourth mount arm and just use 3. It also came with a big variety of screws and bolts which were compatible with my projector.
customer_reviews.author: Tim A.

customer_reviews.title: Nice mount but BEWARE, It DOES NOT FIT the Optima UHD50
customer_reviews.text: Despite being listed as part of the "Frequently bought together" package on the Optima UHD50 page on Amazon, this mount will not work with the Optima UHD50. I called the manufacturer. Here's their reply "... the technician did say that you could return the mount that you currently have and purchase a MOUNT-VP04W. vivo-us.com/products/mount-vp04w. This would work perfect."
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Works great, infinitely adjustable
customer_reviews.text: Works great, infinitely adjustable. You can remove one leg if your projector only has three mounting holes like mine. Comes with all the hardware you could ever need including bolts, washers, and even big screws to mount it to the ceiling. Got it put up in an evening with just a power drill and screwdriver. The hex key for adjusting the angle is included too!
customer_reviews.author: Gazeebo

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly with my new YABER Native 1080P Projector and was a breeze to install. Came with everything needed and it is very sturdy. Good quality for a low price. Can't beat it. Very happy and would purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Dietz Family

customer_reviews.title: Works great for the price. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to adjust for the projector. We struggled getting the bolts tight on the ceiling. It wasn't impossibly, just don't try it when your patience is running thin! It goes onto the project so simply that it seems like you must be doing something wrong when it takes to long to get things tight on the bolts to straighten the image.
customer_reviews.author: JKinSD

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I never expected to pay so little for a ceiling projector mount. It was extremely simply to set up, and versatile enough for almost any position. Some of the bolts ended up stripped, but they’re easy enough to swap out. The mount itself is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: RJ Smith

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect, but dang good for the money.
customer_reviews.text: At this price point, it's obviously kinda cheap, but it's not a total disaster like I expected, it's definitely sturdy enough for smaller projectors, and the adjustments actually tighten down pretty secure.
customer_reviews.author: A Computer Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great for price
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed to ceiling mount a VANYO 510. The bolts it come with are the correct size for the projector but the threads are not very long. Had to cut away about 1/8th of an inch of plastic off the feet of the projector to get this to go in the threads. Otherwise this was perfect and had all the parts and everything you needed to ceiling mount a projector.
customer_reviews.author: ND

customer_reviews.title: Not Universal
customer_reviews.text: This projector mount was labeled as "universal", however it does not fit the Optoma projector I bought it to mount with. The manufacturer should remove the word "Universal" from this product, and should specifically list the models of projectors that this model works with. Ended up returning and finding one of poorer quality but that actually fit the model of projector I had. Would not recommend purchasing this unless you know, for a fact, that it will work with your projector.
customer_reviews.author: carina

customer_reviews.title: No anti-vibration measures leads to shaky video output
customer_reviews.text: Without additional shock absorbing material, such as rubber steppers, when mounted to the ceiling anyone making any movement on the 2nd floor causes the mount to shake and this translates really hard into the projector output.
customer_reviews.author: Hopeless Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy and well made. Completely confident in using it to hold up. Very versatile. Was able to adjust it to fit my projector perfectly. You might need to play around with it a little, but once you get it it will hold just great.
customer_reviews.author: Ai Kobayashi

customer_reviews.title: Impressed at quality and low price.
customer_reviews.text: I was leary when I ordered this because of the low price, but don't let the price deter you as this is a great mount. Received already assembled and comes with all the hardware you need to install your projector. Unless you are mounting a 50lb projector, you can't go wrong with this one.
customer_reviews.author: ronnieraysr

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely the best!
customer_reviews.text: I have compared different kinds of ceiling projector mounts. This Vivo is the best among them all. Not only is it easy to install, you can move the projector in multiple directions, including rotating it. The quick release feature is nice, making it easy to install and remove.
customer_reviews.author: John Yam

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Great projector mount! Only gave 4 stars vs 5 only because I had to go purchase longer bolts for my projector and the other downfall is if you’re hoping to use the philips slot on the mounting bracket the strip out very easily so highly suggest getting the right socket for those bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfect With Epson Projector
customer_reviews.text: This is simple to put together, and installs easily. It is holding up my Epson beautifully on the ceiling, and the swivel arms perfectly aligned with the holes on the projector for mounting. My projector is still on the ceiling, and hasn't come loose yet! These things used to costs a fortune. This works great, and was a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: D.D

customer_reviews.title: Good product, sturdy and versatile but wish it came with longer screws.
customer_reviews.text: All of the screws that come with this mount are really short. We had to take a trip up Home Depot and purchase longer screws. Luckily they were under $1.50. The mount itself is get sturdy and easy to install. It is very versatile. I do recommend this mount just be aware that you may have to buy longer screws.
customer_reviews.author: Amy Randles

customer_reviews.title: Good price but tricky install
customer_reviews.text: Pretty sturdy once it's installed but its not easy to setup. There's about almost a dozen different nuts that need to be adjust to get it tight and that's hard to do with something mounted on the ceiling.
customer_reviews.author: K.K.

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I was able to finally get the thing secured to the ceiling securely and my projector started having a fan failure so I can’t report fully on it but it looks and feels very sturdy, like you could stick a projector sideways if you have some Allen screws.
customer_reviews.author: kevin sweet

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable to different models
customer_reviews.text: Very nice. My projector is a not so expensive unit. It doesn’t have the normal mounting holes. That being said, I was still able to remove some parts to this mount and make it work. It is very sturdy and adjustable.
customer_reviews.author: P. G. S.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good mount. Not the greatest quality of hardware.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty versatile and sturdy. Lot of movement options. Allen wrench is not my favorite adjustment tool but it worked fine. One of the screws stripped out on me when installing into the ceiling. Even with a pilot hole, it stripped out.
customer_reviews.author: Tim L.

customer_reviews.title: Easy install. Easy adjusting.
customer_reviews.text: Super easy install. Bought an Artlii Projector when it was a prime deal and it fits perfect. Super stable. Easy to adjust. I'd recommend. Only thing is could say is having double sided tape to help you install if you don't have an extra pair of hands around to hold it in place as you screw it in.
customer_reviews.author: Marc T.

customer_reviews.title: Run away
customer_reviews.text: Not very sturdy really hard to install the slots for the long mounting screws leave a lot of wiggle and play which is no good. Also took me to long to attempt to mount this so I'm out 20 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Nolo

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install my projector on by myself after reviewing the instructions a few times. It contains only drawings and could use some work and words. Overall, I like it.
customer_reviews.author: It's good

customer_reviews.title: Great product for price.
customer_reviews.text: Need a mount for my vaulted ceiling. All of the long ones were very expensive. I bought this one and took it apart. Bought a PVC pipe and cut to length then sanded off the printing.. Took this mount apart in the middle and attached each half to the pipe. I now have the projector hanging down 3ft and it looks professionally installed. Judging the mount alone it was a great product for the price. Had many adjustments and stayed put once locked into place. Build quality was better than expected.
customer_reviews.author: Barry Stockinger

customer_reviews.title: Works great - no issues
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to set up and is maneuverable enough that it should fit any projector. Easy instructions and only required about 10 minutes for set up. *Make sure you test your projector to determine the position you want it to be placed before you set up the mount.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Great price. Best bang for buck
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with it. Quite sturdy and comes with what's needed. Doesnt take long to install. I installed mine in a benq 632st I think is the model. Fits perfect
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Ry for Short Brian for longer

product_meta.title: VIVO Universal Adjustable White Ceiling Projector, Projection Mount Extending Arms Mounting Bracket (MOUNT-VP01W)
product_meta.description:
Color:WhiteMOUNT-VP01W is a brand new, heavy duty, all steel, universal ceiling projector mount. Ideal for any home or office, this high grade steel mount is weight tested at 30lbs and designed with adjustable arms to fit most projector brands with mounting ranges from 2” to 12.5”. MOUNT-VP01W sits 6” from flat ceilings making it low profile. Features include 15 degree tilt, 15 degree swivel, and 360 degree rotation to maximize projection angles. Simple tightening of joints makes this as fluid or stationary as desired. This is a quick assembly and comes with common mounting hardware. The projector mount comes in a white finish. 

Important Note: As mentioned above the mounting arms for this projector mount have a maximum reach of 12.5”. Before purchasing, be sure to find the mounting holes on top of your projector and measure the distance between each one (especially the ones diagonal from one another). If all diagonals measure 12.5” or less then this mount will fit your projector. 

Compatibility 
Fits most projectors on the market. Distance between mounting holes on back of projector must be 12.5” or less 
High-grade steel supports projectors up to 30 lbs 

Features 
15-degree tilt, 15-degree swivel, and 360-degree rotation, hitting all optimal viewing angles 
Obscure mounting system holds your projector just 6” from the ceiling surface 
Possesses quick release hooks that detach and attach by loosening and tightening mounting bolts 
Quick assembly and comes with common mounting hardware
feature_bullets: UNIVERSAL PROJECTOR MOUNT - Fits the majority of projectors on the market. Distance between mounting holes on back of projector must be 12.5” or less.
STRONG 30 LBS SUPPORT - Made entirely of high-grade steel, this mount holds projectors weighing up to 30 lbs, keeping your expensive equipment safe and secure.
FULLY ADJUSTABLE - Features +15° to -15° tilt, +15° to -15° swivel, and 360° rotation. Hits all the right viewing angles so you and your guests can watch in comfort.
LOW PROFILE - This mounting system holds your projector just 6” from the ceiling surface. The white powder-coated finish blends well with the majority of home and office environments.
EASY INSTALLATION - Quick release hooks attach and detach by tightening and loosening the mounting bolts. All necessary hardware and instructions are provided for assembly.
